ref_item.label: Ocrelizumab
ref_item.description: Ocrelizumab will be administered as two 300 mg IV infusions on Days 1 and 15 followed by one 600 mg IV infusions administered at Weeks 24, 48, and 72.

pred_item.label: Ocrelizumab 600 mg
pred_item.description: Patients with relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis with a suboptimal response to one or two prior disease-modifying therapies received intravenous ocrelizumab 600 mg every 24 weeks throughout the 96-week open-label treatment period for a maximum of four doses (first dose administered as two 300-mg infusions, 14 days apart).

ref_item.name: Ocrelizumab
ref_item.description: Ocrelizumab will be administered as two 300 mg IV infusions on Days 1 and 15 followed by one 600 mg IV infusions administered at Weeks 24, 48, and 72.

pred_item.name: Ocrelizumab
pred_item.description: Intravenous infusion of ocrelizumab 600 mg every 24 weeks for 96 weeks (last dose on Week 72) for a maximum of four doses. The first dose was administered as two 300-mg infusions, 14 days apart.

ref_item.measure: Percentage of Participants With No Evidence of Disease Activity (NEDA) as Per Protocol Defined Events During a 96-Week Period
ref_item.description:
A protocol-defined event of disease activity was defined by the occurrence of at least one of the following while on treatment with ocrelizumab:

* A protocol-defined relapse (PDR)
* 24-week CDP based on increase in EDSS while on treatment with ocrelizumab
* A T1 Gd-enhanced lesion after Week 8
* A new and/or enlarging T2 hyperintense lesion on MRI after Week 8 compared to the Week 8 MRI scan

pred_item.measure: Proportion of patients with no evidence of disease activity (NEDA) over 96 weeks
pred_item.description: NEDA was defined as absence of protocol-defined relapse, 24-week confirmed disability progression (CDP; defined as an increase in EDSS score from baseline of at least 1.0 point), T1-weighted contrast-enhancing lesions (CELs), and new and/or enlarging T2-weighted hyperintense lesions. MRI re-baselining was performed at Week 8.

ref_item.measure: Percentage of Participants Free From a Protocol-Defined Event of Disease Activity During 24 Weeks Period
ref_item.description:
A protocol-defined event of disease activity was defined by the occurrence of at least one of the following while on treatment with ocrelizumab:

* A protocol-defined relapse (PDR)
* 24-week CDP based on increase in EDSS while on treatment with ocrelizumab
* A T1 Gd-enhanced lesion after Week 8
* A new and/or enlarging T2 hyperintense lesion on MRI after Week 8 compared to the Week 8 MRI scan

pred_item.measure: Proportion of patients with NEDA during the initial 24-week period
pred_item.description: NEDA was defined as absence of protocol-defined relapse, 24-week confirmed disability progression, CELs, and new and/or enlarging T2-weighted hyperintense lesions, with MRI re-baselining at Week 8.

ref_item.measure: Percentage of Participants Free From a Protocol-Defined Event of Disease Activity During 48 Weeks Period
ref_item.description:
A protocol-defined event of disease activity was defined by the occurrence of at least one of the following while on treatment with ocrelizumab:

* A protocol-defined relapse (PDR)
* 24-week CDP based on increase in EDSS while on treatment with ocrelizumab
* A T1 Gd-enhanced lesion after Week 8
* A new and/or enlarging T2 hyperintense lesion on MRI after Week 8 compared to the Week 8 MRI scan

pred_item.measure: Proportion of patients with NEDA during the initial 48-week period
pred_item.description: NEDA was defined as absence of protocol-defined relapse, 24-week confirmed disability progression, CELs, and new and/or enlarging T2-weighted hyperintense lesions, with MRI re-baselining at Week 8.

ref_item.measure: Time to First Protocol-Defined Event of Disease Activity
ref_item.description:
The definition of a protocol-defined event of disease activity is the occurrence of at least one of the following while on treatment with ocrelizumab:

* A protocol-defined relapse defined as: Symptoms must persist for \>24 hours and should not be attributable to confounding clinical factors; Symptoms should be preceded by neurological stability for at least 30 days; Symptoms should be accompanied by new objective neurological worsening determined with a timely EDSS/ Functional Systems Score (FSS) assessment
* 24 weeks confirmed disability progression based on increases in EDSS while on treatment with ocrelizumab
* A T1 Gd-enhanced lesion after Week 8
* A new and/or enlarging T2 hyperintense lesion on MRI after Week 8 compared to the Week 8 MRI scan.

pred_item.measure: Time to the first event of disease activity
pred_item.description: Defined as the occurrence of the first event on any NEDA component (relapse, 24-week CDP, CELs, or new/enlarging T2-weighted hyperintense lesions).

ref_item.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 96 in Expanded Disability Status Scale (EDSS)
ref_item.description: The EDSS is an ordinal clinical rating scale ranging from 0 (normal neurologic examination) to 10 (death due to MS) in half-point increments.

pred_item.measure: Mean change in EDSS score from baseline
pred_item.description: Mean change in EDSS score from baseline to Week 96, assessed using a longitudinal mixed-effect model of repeated measures (MMRM).

ref_item.measure: Absolute Change From Baseline in EDSS Category at Week 96
ref_item.description: The EDSS is an ordinal clinical rating scale ranging from 0 (normal neurologic examination) to 10 (death due to MS) in half-point increments.

ref_item.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Baseline EDSS Score ≥2 With CDI at Week 96
ref_item.description: The EDSS is an ordinal clinical rating scale ranging from 0 (normal neurologic examination) to 10 (death due to MS) in half-point increments.

pred_item.measure: Proportion of patients with 24-week confirmed disability progression, stable disability, or confirmed disability improvement (CDI)
pred_item.description: CDI was defined as a reduction in EDSS score ≥ 1.0 point compared with baseline, in patients with a baseline EDSS score ≥ 2.

ref_item.measure: Annualized Protocol-defined Relapse Rate at Week 96

pred_item.measure: Annualized rate of protocol-defined relapses (ARR) at Week 96
pred_item.description: ARR was calculated as the total number of protocol-defined relapses for all patients divided by the total patient-years of exposure to treatment.

ref_item.measure: Time to Onset of 24-week Confirmed Disability Progression

pred_item.description: 24-week CDP was defined as an increase in EDSS score from baseline of at least 1.0 point.

ref_item.measure: Time to Onset of First Protocol-Defined Relapse
ref_item.description:
A protocol-defined multiple sclerosis (MS) relapse is an occurrence of new or worsening neurological symptoms attributable to MS that meets the following criteria:

* Symptoms must persist for \>24 hours and should not be attributable to confounding clinical factors (e.g., fever, infection, injury, adverse reactions to medications)
* Symptoms should be preceded by neurological stability for at least 30 days
* Symptoms should be accompanied by new objective neurological worsening determined with a timely EDSS/ Functional Systems Score (FSS) assessment, consistent with an increase of at least:

  * ≥ 0.5 points on EDSS scale
  * or ≥ 2 points on one of the following FSS scales: pyramidal, ambulation, cerebellar, brainstem, sensory, or visual
  * or ≥ 1 point on two or more of the following FSS scales: pyramidal, ambulation, cerebellar, brainstem, sensory, or visual

pred_item.measure: Time to onset of the first protocol-defined relapse
pred_item.description: Protocol-defined relapse was defined as occurrence of new or worsening neurological symptoms attributable to MS.

ref_item.measure: Time to Onset of First New and/or Enlarging T2 Lesion

pred_item.measure: Time to first new and/or enlarging T2-weighted hyperintense lesion on brain MRI
pred_item.description: Time to occurrence of first new and/or enlarging T2-weighted hyperintense lesion detected on MRI from Week 8 baseline.

ref_item.measure: Mean Number of T1 Gd-enhancing Lesions Per MRI Scan at Weeks 24, 48 and 96
ref_item.description: Mean number of T1 Gd-enhancing lesions per MRI scan: Total number of T1 Gd-enhanced lesions divided by the total number of interpretable MRI scans

pred_item.measure: Total number of T1-weighted contrast-enhancing lesions (CELs)
pred_item.description: Total number of CELs detected on brain MRI at Weeks 24, 48, and 96.

ref_item.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 96 in Total T2 Lesion Volume Detected by Brain MRI From

pred_item.measure: Change in total T2-weighted hyperintense lesion volume
pred_item.description: Change in total T2-weighted hyperintense lesion volume from Week 8 to Week 96.

ref_item.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline to Week 96 in Total T2 Lesion Volume Detected by Brain MRI
Volume of New and/or Enlarging T2 Hyperintense Lesions Volume of Lesions Per MRI Scan at Weeks 24, 48, 96
ref_item.description: The number of new and/or enlarging T2 lesions at week 24, 48 and 96 is calculated as the sum of the individual number of new and/or enlarging lesions at each visit. Data from other unscheduled assessments is included in this summary or analysis.

pred_item.measure: Volume and number of new and/or enlarging T2-weighted hyperintense lesions
pred_item.description: Volume and number of new and/or enlarging T2-weighted hyperintense lesions from Week 8 to Weeks 24, 48, and 96.

ref_item.measure: Mean Number of New and/or Enlarging T2 Hyperintense Lesions Per MRI Scan
ref_item.description: Mean number of new and/or enlarging T2 hyperintense lesions per MRI scan: Total number of new and/or enlarging T2 hyperintense lesions divided by the total number of interpretable MRI scans

ref_item.measure: Change From Baseline at Week 48 and 96 in T1 Hypointense Lesion Volume
Percentage Change From Baseline at Week 48 and 96 in T1 Hypointense Lesion Volume
Adjusted Mean Change From Baseline at Week 48 and 96 in T1 Hypointense Lesion Volume
Adjusted Mean Percentage Change From Baseline in Brain Volume

pred_item.measure: Percentage change in cerebral whole-brain volume (WBV)
pred_item.description: Percentage change in WBV from Week 8, assessed using SIENA/X.

ref_item.measure: Adjusted Mean Percentage Change From Baseline in Cortical Grey Matter Volume

pred_item.measure: Percentage change in cortical gray matter volume (CGMV)
pred_item.description: Percentage change in CGMV from Week 8, assessed using paired Jacobian integration.

ref_item.measure: Adjusted Mean Percentage Change From Baseline in White Matter Volume

pred_item.measure: Percentage change in white matter volume (WMV)
pred_item.description: Percentage change in WMV from Week 8, assessed using paired Jacobian integration.

ref_item.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Cognitive Performance (Processing Speed/Working Memory) at Week 48 and Week 96 as Measured by the Brief International Cognitive Assessment for MS - Symbol Digit Modalities Test (SDMT) Score
ref_item.description: Brief International Cognitive Assessment for MS (BICAMS) is assessing cognitive processing speed and verbal and visual memory. Symbol Digits Modalities Test (SDMT) is assessing processing speed/working memory. The SDMT presents a series of nine symbols, each paired with a single digit in a key at the top of a standard sheet of paper. Participants are asked to voice the digit associated with each symbol as rapidly as possible for 90 sec. There is a single outcome measure - the number correct over the 90 sec time span. The higher the results, the better processing speed/working memory.

ref_item.measure: Change From Baseline in Cognitive Performance (Visuospatial Memory) at Week 48 and Week 96 as Measured by the Brief International Cognitive Assessment for MS - Brief Visuospatial Memory Test-Revised (BVMT-R) Score
ref_item.description: Brief International Cognitive Assessment for MS (BICAMS) is assessing cognitive processing speed and verbal and visual memory. Brief Visuospatial Memory Test-Revised (BVMT-R) is assessing visuospatial memory. In this test, six abstract designs are presented for 10 sec. The display is removed from view and patients render the stimuli via pencil on paper manual responses. Each design receives from 0 to 2 points representing accuracy and location. There are three learning trials, and the outcome measure is the total number of points earned over the three learning trials, thus the scale range is 0-36. The higher the result, the better visual/spatial memory.

ref_item.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Cognitive Performance (Processing Speed/Working Memory) at Week 48 and Week 96 as Measured by the Brief International Cognitive Assessment for MS - Symbol Digit Modalities Test (SDMT) Score
ref_item.description: Brief International Cognitive Assessment for MS (BICAMS) is assessing cognitive processing speed and verbal and visual memory. Symbol Digits Modalities Test (SDMT) is assessing processing speed/working memory. The SDMT presents a series of nine symbols, each paired with a single digit in a key at the top of a standard sheet of paper. Participants are asked to voice the digit associated with each symbol as rapidly as possible for 90 sec. There is a single outcome measure - the number correct over the 90 sec time span.

ref_item.measure: Percentage Change From Baseline in Cognitive Performance (Visuospatial Memory) at Week 48 and Week 96 as Measured by the Brief International Cognitive Assessment for MS - Brief Visuospatial Memory Test-Revised (BVMT-R) Score
ref_item.description: Brief International Cognitive Assessment for MS (BICAMS) is assessing cognitive processing speed and verbal and visual memory. Brief Visuospatial Memory Test-Revised (BVMT-R) is assessing visuospatial memory. In this test, six abstract designs are presented for 10 sec. The display is removed from view and patients render the stimuli via pencil on paper manual responses. Each design receives from 0 to 2 points representing accuracy and location. There are three learning trials, and the outcome measure is the total number of points earned over the three learning trials, thus the scale range is 0-36. The higher the result, the better visual/spatial memory.

ref_item.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
ref_item.timeFrame: Baseline up to to 96 weeks after the end of the Treatment Period
